translation: What is the friend of the sun that brings warmth and happiness?
hint: It comes in the morning and brightens the day.

riddle: नद्या प्रवहन्ति किन्तु स्थिरा न भवति।
translation: The river flows but it never becomes stagnant.
hint: It keeps moving and never stops.

riddle: मेघश्यामोऽस्मि नो कृष्णो, महाकायो न पर्वतः । बलिष्ठोऽस्मि न भीमोऽस्मि, कोऽस्म्यहं नासिकाकरः ॥
translation: I am cloud-dark but not black, big-bodied but not a mountain. I am strong but not fearsome; who am I with long ears and nose?
hint: It’s a large, strong animal with long ears and trunk.

riddle: एकाकी द्वारी तिष्ठामि गृहपतौ बहिर्गते। गृहरक्षाकरः शुरो लघुमूर्तिः सुकीर्तिमान्॥
translation: I stand alone at the door when the householder goes out. I guard the house, brave but small in form and famous in deed.
hint: It secures the house and can be small but important.

riddle: स्नेहं ददाति यो मह्यं, नित्यं तस्मै ददाम्यहम् । ज्योतिः पदार्थज्ञानार्थं, कोऽपि वदतु साम्प्रतम् ॥
translation: Who gives me love, I give it daily. Food and drink it gives, I give knowledge through light. Burning all night, I am the source of light’s breath. Tell my strong name if you are wise and brave.
hint: It burns to give light through the night.

riddle: वृक्षाग्रवासी न च पक्षिराजः, त्रिनेत्रधारी न च शूलपाणिः । त्वग्वस्त्रधारी न च सिद्ध योगी, जलं च बिप्रन्ह घटोत्कचः न मेघः ॥
translation: It lives atop trees but is not the king of birds; has three eyes but is not Shiva; wears bark like clothing but is not an ascetic; holds water but is neither a pot nor cloud.
hint: A tropical fruit known for its hard shell and water content.

riddle: न तस्यादिः न तस्यान्तः मध्ये यः तस्य तिष्ठति। तवाप्यस्ति ममाप्यस्ति यदि जानासि तद्वद।।
translation: It has no start nor end 'na', but in the middle it has 'ya' which you and I both have. What is it?

riddle: वृक्षाग्रवासी न च पक्षिराजः तृणं च शय्या न च राजयोगी। सुवर्णकायो न च हेमधातुः पुल्लिङ्गो न च राजपुत्रः॥
translation: A king who lives in trees but not a bird; bed of grass but not a yogi; golden body but not gold; male but not a prince.
hint: A common fruit with golden-yellow skin.

riddle: अस्ती कुक्षी शिरो नास्ती बाहु रूअस्ती निरंगुली। अहतो नर भक्षकः यो जनाति स: पंडितः।।
translation: It has a belly but no head, arms but no fingers; it holds the human body together. Know this to be wise.
hint: A piece of clothing worn on the upper body.

riddle: कृष्णमुखी न मार्जारी द्विजिह्वा न च सर्पिणी। पञ्चभर्ता न पाञ्चाली यो जानाति स पण्डितः ॥
translation: Black-mouthed but not a cat; two tongues but not a snake; five holders but not Draupadi. He who knows is wise.
